In three sentences
Comments
Public Security can be seen easily walking/driving around campus and checking up on situations.
I am a member of Pi-Theta-Kappa.
I am not associated with clubs or activities on campus, but the main student association provides food and drinks to students occasionally and they have monthly or weekly events.

Great for those who want an inexpensive education in a midsized town and small class sizes. Almost all of my classes have 10 to 15 students. Very few classes have over 20 - those are classes in halls or large class rooms.
I do not know of any, although, the parking lots were not designed for easy access to doors; one always has to walk a slight distance to get to a door.
Classes are CHEAP. About 100$ per credit hour.
Explore Belleville. Also, there is the Metro-Link train station on campus which links you to St. Louis instantly. Free train pass is included with classes.
Fairly expensive on campus. There is a Starbucks and cafeteria.
Liberal Arts classes are easy, while maths and especially sciences are more challenging.

Be sure to apply for graduation on time, and do not wait till the last minuet for counseling for any issues at all. Double check and triple check to make sure your classes can/will transfer as you want them to.
The classes are fairly easy and teachers are understanding of student needs. The facilities are very nice; they have a brand new edition to their Liberal Arts building which is impressive.
pageTitle: Southwestern Illinois College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
textBeforeTable: 12/17/2009 Reviewer is Accepted here and planning to attend soon. Reviewer has been to campus. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 1 of 37 Alexander from Waterloo, IL Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: Its a small cafeteria in one building. Reminds me of high school lunch room. Dorm Life No Dorms. Academic Rigor Exceedingly easy hardly any effort on my part. Tips for prospective students Good for Gen. Eds. Not much else. In three sentences I give Southwestern Illinois College a C. It's a low cost junior college but I am not challenged and the classes are way to easy. Login to rate or flag the reviews Katie from Collinsville, IL 01/27/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 of 37 Categories Comments Great for these types of students I cannot just start naming out types of students that Southwestern Illinois College is great for because this college is simply great for everyone!
